webLinks.linkText: TfNSW interactive road closure and clearway map - Mardi Gras 2026

properties.publicTransport: Buses between the city and the east will be diverting and using different stops between 4pm and 2am while roads are closed. Museum Station will be closed from 5pm until 4am for crowd safety. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of spectators will line the streets to see the Mardi Gras Parade travel from Hyde Park to Moore Park via Oxford St, Flinders St and Anzac Pde from 7.30pm to 10:30pm. Pedestrian crossing of Oxford St and Flinders St will be available until 6:30pm only.

Major roads will be closed between4 pm and 2am. Motorists are urged to avoid unnecessary travel in the CBD and Moore Park and to expect delays as traffic will be heavy on detour routes. Motorists travelling between the city and eastern suburbs will be diverted via Cleveland St in the south or via William St and Darlinghurst Rd in the north. 

Key road closure timings Sat 28 Feb to Sun 1 Mar:

  • From 4pm to 1am: sections of College St, Liverpool St, Wentworth Ave, Goulburn St and surrounding local streets.
  • From 4pm to 2am: Flinders St northbound lanes from Moore Park Rd to Oxford St.
  • From 4pm to 4am: sections of Bourke St, Campbell St, Short St and surrounding local streets in Surry Hills.
  • From 5.30pm to 1am: Anzac Pde northbound from Cleveland St to Moore Park Rd, and local roads in Surry Hills between Elizabeth St and Campbell St including Nithsdale St, Foster St, and Wentworth Ave.
  • From 5.30pm to 2am: Major closures along parade route including Liverpool St, Oxford St between College St and Darlinghurst Rd, Flinders St southbound from Oxford St to Moore Park Rd, sections of Crown St, sections of South Dowling between Oxford St and Fitzroy St, and Anzac Pde southbound from Moore Park Rd to Lang Rd, including the Eastern Distributor Randwick Anzac Pde off-ramp (Bondi exit remains open).
  • From 6.30pm to 1am: Moore Park Rd westbound from Oatley Rd to South Dowling St, no access to Eastern Distributor and Driver Ave between Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd (until 10am Sunday).

Single lanes will also be closed on sections of Oxford St, Flinders St, Wentworth Ave, College St and Elizabeth St during the day and in the evening on Saturday. As well, sections of Hill St, Clare St, and surrounding local streets will close from 7am Saturday until 2am Monday.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will also be in place between 6am Saturday 28 February and 2am Sunday 1 March on roads along and surrounding the parade route in the Sydney CBD, Darlinghurst, Surry Hills and Moore Park including sections Oxford St, Flinders St, College St, Wentworth Ave, Park St and Liverpool St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Oxford Street, Flinders Street and Anzac Parade

webLinks.linkText: What's on at the TikTok Entertainment Centre

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Upcoming events at TikTok Entertainment Centre (ICC Sydney Theatre):

  • Matt Rife 'Stay Golden World Tour' - Friday 30 and Saturday 31 January
  • The Music of John Williams: Episode II - Saturday 7 February
  • An Evening with Dream Theater 40th Anniversary Tour - Saturday 14 February
  • GIVĒON - Wednesday 18 February
  • A Special Evening with Christian Horner - Thursday 26 February
  • Josh Groban - Saturday 28 February

﻿Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the shows, particularly during peak evening periods.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: North Sydney Council - North Sydney Streets Crows Nest

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 115 and 263 will divert around a section of Willoughby Road and use temporary stops while roads are closed for the event. Allow extra time and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the North Sydney Streets festival in Crows Nest from 12pm to 5pm on Saturday 21 February.

Road closures will be in place to safely facilitate the event.

Traffic is expected to be heavy on roads approaching Crows Nest including along the Pacific Hwy and Falcon St throughout the day.

  • Willoughby Road will be closed to vehicle traffic between Albany St and Falcon St from 7am to 11pm.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic controllers on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Upcoming festivals at Bondi Beach

  • Crowded House, Friday 20 February, 5pm to 10pm
  • Mighty Hoopla, Saturday 21 February, 2pm to 10pm

With large crowds expected, traffic will be heavy on roads approaching Bondi Beach. Motorists should allow extra travel time and expect delays on Campbell Pde, Bondi Rd, Old South Head Rd and Syd Einfeld Dr. Local roads and carparks at Bondi Beach will be closed before, during and after the event.

Changed traffic conditions and parking restrictions: 

  • Queen Elizabeth Drive: south of Bondi Pavilion closed from 4pm Thu 19 Feb until 6am Sun 22 Feb. Enter and exit Queen Elizabeth Drive (north) from the northern end during this time.
  • Park Drive South Carpark: Closed from 8pm Mon 16 Feb to 6am Tue 24 Feb
  • Parking zone restrictions will be in place to support the above closures. Any vehicles parked in these areas during this period will be towed. 

Road closures: Campbell Parade will close southbound from Curlewis Street from 9:30pm until 10:30pm on Fri 20 Feb and Sat 21 Feb, with detours in place.

properties.publicTransport: Event shuttle buses will run between Blacktown Interchange and Sydney Motorsport throughout the event. For more details, visit transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Supercars Sydney 500 at Sydney Motorsport Park in Eastern Creek from Friday 20 to Sunday 22 February. Event starts at 11:10am on Friday, 11.15am on Saturday and 8.40am on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra time on the Great Western Hwy, M4 Mwy, M7 Mwy, Wallgrove Rd, Chandos Rd, Horsley Dr and Ferrers Rd approaching Eastern Creek over the weekend.

Limited free parking will be available at Sydney Motorsport Park. Access is via Gate D, off Ferrers Road.

Attendees should allow plenty of additional time for parking and access to the site.

roads.mainStreet: Great Western Highway, M4 Motorway, M7 Motorway, Wallgrove Rd, Ferrers Rd

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets and additional light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby Waratahs v Druas at Allianz Stadium. Kick off at 7.35pm, full time at 9.20pm.

Traffic will be heavy on approach and within Moore Park.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4.30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.   
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. Car Parks open from 4.35pm. 
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to 11pm daily on sections of Cleveland Street and Fitzroy Street and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Albion Street and Lang Road. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator. 

From 6am to 11pm 

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (southern side) 
  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie Street and South Dowling Street (northern side) 
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side) 

From 3pm to 11pm 

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides) 
  • Lang Road between Anzac Parade and Errol Flynn Boulevard (northern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Silver Slipper Stakes Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race at 12.25pm, last race from 6pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Trial match at polytec Stadium:

  • Match 1 - Sharks v Raiders kick off at 3.50pm
  • Match 2 - Roosters v Eels kick off at 6pm
  • Full time at 7.45pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the match.

Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 2.15pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Macarthur FC game at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm, finish at 8pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow.

For passenger drop-off, use the allocated 10-minute loading zone in the McDonald Jones Stadium car park. Entry is via the driveway off Turton Road.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.﻿

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will use different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Tropfest at Centennial Park from 12pm to 10.30pm approx.

With thousands of attendees expected traffic will be heavier than usual in the area. Motorists should expect delays on Anzac Pde, Lang Rd, Oxford St, Syd Einfeld Drive, Darley Rd, York Rd and Alison Rd.

Road closures and changed access arrangements will be in effect to allow crowds to safely leave the park after the event.

From 8pm there will be no direct access to the Entertainment Quarter from Anzac Parade or Oxford St due to closures of Lang Rd. Vehicle access will be permitted via Moore Park Rd eastbound only (under traffic management) and Cook Rd - follow signs and directions of traffic controllers

From 8pm to midnight 

  • Driver Avenue between Lang Road and MacArthur Avenue (southern turning circle) (northbound)  
  • Lang Road between Errol Flynn Boulevard and Anzac Parade (westbound) – no right turn exit from Errol Flynn Boulevard. 
  • Lang Road* between Mitchell Street and Moore Park Road (both directions) *Note: Managed access for residents maintained 
  • Moore Park Road between Oxford Street and Cook Road (westbound) – no access to the EQ precinct via Moore Park Road; access via Cook and Lang roads only.  

From 9pm to midnight 

  • Driver Avenue between MacArthur Avenue (southern turning circle) and Lang Road (southbound) 
  • Lang Rd between Anzac Parade to Errol Flynn Boulevard (eastbound) – no access to the EQ precinct via Anzac Parade; access via Cook Road and Lang Road only.  
  • Moore Park Road* between Oatley Road and Oxford Street (eastbound) *Note: Managed access for residents maintained 

Gate closures and parking restrictions will also be in place within Centennial Parklands - see the Centennial Parklands website for more information.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 11am to 11.30pm on sections of Fitzroy Street, Lang Road and Oxford Street, and from 6am to 11.30pm on sections of Cleveland Street. Driver Avenue will also have clearways all day.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator

arrangementElements.html:
Clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies. Visit Live Traffic NSW for a map and more details.  

From 12:01am to 11.59pm:  

  • Driver Avenue between Lang Road and Moore Park Road (both sides) 

From 6am to 11.30pm 

  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (southern side) 
  • Cleveland Street between Abercrombie Street and South Dowling Street (northern side) 

From 11am to 11.30pm 

  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side) 
  • Lang Road between Anzac Parade and Errol Flynn Boulevard (northern side) 
  • Oxford Street between Queen Street and Jersey Road (southern side) 
  • Oxford Street between Queen Street and Victora Avenue (northern side)

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Auckland FC at Leichhardt Oval. Kick-off 7pm, full time around 9pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on James St, Perry St, Balmain Rd, Mary St and Glover St as attendees travel to and from the match.

A section of Mary Street may close before the game and will reopen when crowds have cleared the area. Traffic will be detoured via Chapel St while the closure is in place.   

Motorists requiring access to other venues in the area should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: City of Ryde - Lunar New Year Eastwood

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 515, 521, 544 and 545 will be diverting and using alternative stops from 5.30am to 11.30pm while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Lunar New Year Festival at Eastwood Oval from 12pm to 9pm.

The following road closure will be in effect to safely facilitate the event:

  • From 11am Friday 27 February: Commuter Carpark at the intersection of East Parade and Railway Parade. Carpark will reopen by 11.30pm Saturday 28 February.
  • From 6am Saturday 28 February: Railway Parade between Rowe Street and Ethel Street. A section of Rowe Lane will also be closed. Roads will reopen by 11.30pm Saturday 28 February.
  • From 10am Saturday 28 February: West Parade between Wingate Avenue and Hillview Road. Road will reopen by 11pm Saturday 28 February.

Motorists will be diverted via local roads, and should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Route buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lakemba Nights during Ramadan will be held on Haldon Street in Lakemba every Thursday to Sunday, 6pm-2am from 19 February to 15 March.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly during the busy weeknight peaks on Thursdays and Fridays during the event.

Road closures Thursday to Sunday, 4pm to 4.30am, from Thursday 19 February to Sunday 15 March

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and Gillies St
  • Haldon St between 168 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Quigg St (The Boulevarde will open at 4am) 
  • Gilles St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies Lane between Gillies St and Quigg St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St and Haldon St 
  • Oneata Lane between The Boulevarde and Oneata St. 

Motorists should allow plenty of extra time, and follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.

Some sections of Haldon Street, Oneata Street, Gillies Street and The Boulevarde will turn into No Stopping Tow Away zones every Thursday-Sunday from 3.30pm-6pm from 19 February-15 March. Please read the signage and comply with new regulations to avoid being towed.
properties.diversions:
Motorists will be detoured around the road closures on Thu-Sun via the following routes: 

  • Southbound traffic in Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde/Moreton St/The Boulevarde/Quigg St/Grace Ave/Haldon St to Canterbury Rd. 
  • Northbound traffic in Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave/Quigg St/The Boulevarde/Moreton St to Lakemba St. 
  • Eastbound traffic in The Boulevarde west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd. 
  • Westbound traffic in The Boulevarde east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St/Grace Ave/Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Route 308 buses will be diverting around Redfern St while it's closed for the event. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney – Sydney Streets event on Redfern Street. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

  • Redfern St will be closed between Regent St and Chalmers St in both directions from 7am until 11:30pm.
  • Sections of Renwick St, Glover Lan and George St will also be closed during this time.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Redfern St, George St and Renwick St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:

  • George St between Turner St and Philip St

  • Renwick St between Turner St and Wells St
  • Glover Ln between Turner St and Redfern St

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below unless stated otherwise. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearways will be in place to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations

Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones and also apply to local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: Spin Out Rock and Roll Festival

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will be diverting, missing stops and using temporary stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Spin Out Rock 'N Roll Festival on John Street in Camden on Saturday 21 February.

John Street will be closed from 5am until 5pm between Mitchell Street and Argle Street to safely facilitate the event.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around the Town Centre during this time.

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time, follow diversion signs and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Stop/slow traffic conditions will be in place on Kosciuszko Rd to allow participants to safely cross Kosciuszko Rd.

Motorists are reminded to slow down and follow the directions of traffic controllers.

properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert due to road closures in the CBD. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to take part in and attend the the annual St Patrick's Day Parade in Sydney CBD. The parade will travel north along Pitt Street from Martin Place at 11am and will finish at Alfred Street at Circular Quay at midday. Road closures and special event clearways will be in place in the Sydney CBD and The Rocks to support the event.


Pitt Street will be closed from Hunter St to Kings St from 8:30am to 12pm midday. There will be no access to Angel Pl, Hosking Pl, Abercrombie Ln, Bond St, Bulletin Ln, Curtin Pl, Dalley St, Hamilton St, Hunter St or Underwood St from Pitt St between 8:30am and 12pm midday.

Grosvenor St/Bridge St will be closed between Lang St and Young St from 10:30am to 12:30pm

***The cycle ways on Pitt St between Hunter St and King St and between Bridge St and Hunter St will close between 8:30am and 12:30pm

From 10am to 12pm midday:

  • Pitt St will be closed between Alfred St and Hunter St
  • Sections of Hunter St, Loftus St, Loftus Ln, Spring St, Reiby Pl, Bent St and Custom House Ln will be closed.

From 10.30am to 12pm midday:

  • Hickson Rd will be closed from Pottinger St to Elevate Rd
  • Sections of George St and Essex St will be closed.

George St will be closed between Lower Fort St and Hickson Rd for The Rocks Market from 4am on Saturday 14 March to 12 midnight on Tuesday 17 March.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 1pm on the eastern side of Pitt St between Bridge St and King St and on sections of Bridge St and Loftus St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets and additional light rail services will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar. Kick-off at 5pm, finish around 6.45pm.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the roads including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions:

  • Driver Avenue will be partially closed outside the stadium from 2pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area.   
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Avenue, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop-off areas maintained from Lang Road. EP3 Grass Car Park opens from 2pm.
  • Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 6am to 8pm daily on sections of Cleveland Street and surrounding areas from 3pm to 8pm on sections of Albion Street, Lang Road and Fitzroy Street. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, full time around 6.50pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the match.

Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 3.30pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Upcoming concerts at Qudos Bank Arena

  • Mon 16 Feb - Lainey Wilson, show starts at 7pm.
  • Wed 18 and Thu 19 Feb - Lorde, show starts nightly at 7.50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to Olympic Park in the already busy weeknight peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: T8 trackwork is taking place on Saturday 28 February with buses replacing trains between Macarthur, Glenfield and Fairfield. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men matches at Campbelltown Sports Stadium:

  • Macarthur FC v Central Coast Mariners on Wednesday 25 February - Kick off at 7pm, full time at 9pm
  • Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers on Saturday 28 February - Kick off at 7.35pm, full time at 9.35pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to and from the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd.

Motorists should also be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the match.

Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed from 3.30pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race at 12:25pm, last race at 6pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL Community Series: Sydney Swans v GWS Giants at Henson Park. Kick off at 4.10pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching Henson Park as attendees travel to and from the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Sydenham Rd, Illawarra Rd, Livingstone Rd and Addison Rd. 

Sections of Woodland St and Holmesdale St surrounding the park may be closed for the event.

Limited parking is available at Centennial St at Henson Park and on local surrounding streets. Plan to arrive early to secure a parking spot.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrians in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Lunar New Year Festival in Cabramatta Town Centre on Saturday 28 February from 11am to 9pm.

The following road closure will be in effect to safely facilitate the event:

  • From 8pm Thursday 26 February: Arthur Street Carpark closed until 2am Monday 2 March. Denton Lane also closed (reopens for deliveries only at 2am Sunday 1 March).
  • From 8pm Friday 27 February: Park Road, Arthur Street and Dutton Lane closed until 2am Sunday 1 March.
  • Hughes Street carpark remains open. Taxi access to Arthur Street maintained.

Motorists will be diverted via local roads, and should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

arrangementElements.html:
• From 8pm Friday 14 February until 2am Monday 17 February: Arthur Street Car Park and Denton Lane* will be closed.  
  • From 8pm Friday 14 February until 2am Sunday 16 February: Park Road and Arthur Street will be closed.  

The Hughes Street Car Park will remain open, and Taxis can access the Arthur Street Taxi Stand.

*Denton Lane will reopen at 2am Sunday 16 February for deliveries only.
arrangementElements.title: Road Closures

properties.otherAdvice:
The Snowies Mountain Bike Festival and National Trial Running Championships will see 1,000 competitors compete in multiple courses around the region.

For the safety of participants alternating (stop/slow) traffic conditions will be in place on Kosciuszko Rd. Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.

Local road closures will be in place over the weekend for the NSW Triathlon Championships.

There will be increased pedestrian activity.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT NSW Triathlon Club Championships

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on trains, metro and light rail. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Bad Bunny at ENGIE Stadium on Saturday 28 February and Sunday 1 March.

With up to 45,000 Bad Bunny fans each night plus an additional 10,000 Hilltop Hoods fans on Saturday, the precinct will be very busy on the weekend.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event. View the interactive map for closure details

  • Dawn Fraser Avenue from Showground Road to Edwin Flack Avenue
  • Olympic Boulevard from Herb Elliott Avenue to Edwin Flack Avenue

  • Edwin Flack Avenue / Kevin Coombs Avenue / Marjorie Jackson from Pondage Link to Bennelong Parkway.
  • Australia Avenue / Holker Busway from Hill Road to New England Avenue

properties.otherAdvice:
Concerts at Qudos Bank Arena:

  • Good Charlotte - Wednesday 25 February. Show starts at 7pm, finishes at 11pm
  • Jason Aldean - Thursday 26 February. Show starts at 8pm, finishes at 10.45pm
  • Hilltop Hoods - Friday 27 & Saturday 28 February. Shows start nightly at 8pm and finish at 10.50pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to Olympic Park in the already busy weeknight peak.

Fans travelling to the Hilltop Hoods show on Saturday 28 February should be aware that the precinct will be particularly busy that night with 40,000 fans expected at nearby ENGIE Stadium for the Bad Bunny concert at the same time.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you have to drive, carpool with your group pre-book your parking online ahead of time to secure a space – available until 11:59pm the night before the event unless sold out prior. 

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety from Saturday 28 February to Monday 2 March. View the interactive map for closure details
